title: SA Weather: Severe fire danger amid hot conditions
text:
Hot, dry and windy conditions today have prompted fire bans and Severe danger warnings for several parts of South Australia.

The warning has been issued for the West Coast, Lower Eyre Peninsula, Mid North, Mount Lofty Ranges, Yorke Peninsula and Kangaroo Island.

Total fire bans are in place for all six districts.

It is expected to reach 34C in Adelaide today, with northeasterly winds reaching 30 km/h around the metro area.

The weather bureau says winds could blow at speeds of up to 45 km/h during the morning in other areas.

Conditions are expected to worsen on Thursday, with a top of 36C forecast and winds blowing up to 35 km/h in Adelaide.

Friday should also be warm, with a maximum of 32C forecast, but a sprinkle of rain (1-4mm) will provide some respite.

The cool change will then arrive overnight on Friday, bringing temperatures down to 22C on Saturday.

On Tuesday, all six weather stations around Adelaide recorded temperatures of 10C above the October average of 21C.
description: Total fire bans have been issued for several parts of South Australia, including the Mount Lofty Ranges, amid hot and windy conditions forecast today.
